content:
Diagnosis:	Locally advanced gastric adenocarcinoma (poorly cohesive type)

Management:	15 Jan 2024 Started FLOT neoadjuvant chemotherapy
		20 Feb 2024 Cycle 2 completed with dose reduction
		15 Mar 2024 Cycle 3 completed at reduced dose

Histology:	Poorly cohesive adenocarcinoma, HER2 negative, MSI-high
		Stage cT4aN2M0 (Stage IIIB)

Current Situation:	Pre-cycle 4 FLOT assessment

I reviewed [redacted name] today who is making good progress through neoadjuvant chemotherapy for locally advanced gastric cancer. The initial significant toxicities we encountered after cycle 1, particularly the grade 3 neutropenia and grade 2 peripheral neuropathy, have improved following the 20% dose reduction implemented before cycle 2. His current ECOG performance status is 1, improved from 2 at diagnosis.

He reports good appetite and has maintained his weight at 72kg over the past month. The early satiety symptoms that were prominent at diagnosis have significantly improved. He continues to experience grade 1 peripheral neuropathy affecting his fingertips, but this is not impacting daily activities. His previous profound fatigue has improved to grade 1.

Recent CT imaging on 18 March 2024 shows encouraging partial response with reduction in gastric wall thickening from 28mm to 15mm and reduction in size of perigastric nodes. No new concerning features identified.

On examination today, epigastric tenderness has improved and there is no evidence of ascites. Blood results show stable parameters with neutrophils 2.8, platelets 165, and normal liver function tests.

The plan is to proceed with cycle 4 FLOT at current doses. We will arrange repeat staging CT after cycle 4 and refer back to MDT for surgical planning. I have also requested repeat nutritional assessment. We will review again in three weeks prior to final cycle.
